problem_statement:
list_concat() only accepts 2 args whereas concat() accepts n args
### What happens?

According to https://github.com/duckdb/duckdb/pull/14443, it looks like the intention was to make `list_concat` work with N args. But if we test this, it errors: `SELECT list_concat([2, 3], [4, 5, 6], [7]);`

It looks like this PR got merged because only the concat() function was tested, which DOES accent N args: `SELECT concat([2, 3], [4, 5, 6], [7]);`

So, I propose that we should make the list_concat be an alias for concat, and behave exactly the same (skipping NULLs, accepting N args). Similarly, then the `||` operator will work the same for strings and arrays, propagating NULLs.

### To Reproduce

`SELECT list_concat([2, 3], [4, 5, 6], [7]);`
